boulders.name: Cranking Queenie Boulder
boulders.description: This boulder is adjacent to the north of Pump Boulder and has a very overhanging north face through the cave.

routes.name: The Jam Crack
routes.description: Climb the crack on the North side of the boulder.

routes.name: Cranking Queenie
routes.description: Sit start and climb up on manufactured holds. Top out direct (bold) or left.

routes.name: Aftershock
routes.description: Start with the right hand on a good edge and jump for the left leaning rail and top out.

routes.name: Say Goodnight
routes.description: Start with left hand on a sharp sloper and right on a small crimp. Climb up and slightly left to top, right arete is off.

boulders.name: Boulder Behind Pump Rock
boulders.description: The boulder directly behind Pump Rock.

routes.name: West Face
routes.description: Start on sidepulls and cimb up to the sloping arete and mantle. Directly behind Pump Rock.

boulders.name: Pump Rock
boulders.description: This boulder lies just north of Boulder 1 and has a traverse around its lip

routes.name: Pump Traverse
routes.description: Stand start at the south-east corner and traverse the        lip of the bouler to the north-west corner and top out. The sit start at the south-east corner is V1 and the sit start at he south-west corner is V2.

routes.name: Pump Arete
routes.description: Climb the north-east arete via a sit start.

routes.name: North Face Pump Rock
routes.description: Climb Straight up the face and mantle.

boulders.name: Boulder 1
boulders.description: This is the obvious large boulder.

routes.name: West Arete
routes.description: Cimb up the west arete via ledges, sidepulls and pockets.

routes.name: Nylon Boy
routes.description: Just left of Boot Flake, climb up to a sidepull then to the top.

routes.name: Boot Flake
routes.description: Start slightly to the right of the "boot". Gain a right hand crimp and make a big move to the boot. Carefully top out.

routes.name: Endo Boy
routes.description: This line climbs to the right of Boot Flake via sidepulls and crimps.

routes.name: Bob Kamps Face
routes.description: Climb the easy face right of Endo Boy.

routes.name: Short Story
routes.description: A funcky high step leads to a bomber sidepull and a mantle finish.

routes.name: Vivarin
routes.description: Gain the ledge and climb decent holds to the top.

routes.name: Southeast Corner
routes.description: Start with a left side pull and right side pinch. Balancy feet move you up to a small right crimper and a left sloper. Bounce up a bit higher to grab the good left hand on the half moon hold and top out.
Move up the face on very thin crimps and feet to the good high incut on the face. Throw the left hand up high over the lip for a slopey hold, get the feet up high and grab the finishing bucket.

routes.name: Three Pigs
routes.description: Climb the pin scars on the east side of the boulder. Avoiding the scars is a grade or two harder.

routes.name: Undercling
routes.description: Start at the flake and move into the undercling with slippery feet. Reach over the top for a chipped hold and top out. Without the chipped hold it is V4 (Real Yabo Mantle).

routes.name: Yabo Mantle
routes.description: Start of opposing sidepulls, climb up through a small undercling pinch to a rounded shelf and do a hard mantle.

routes.name: Leaping Lizards
routes.description: Dyno off the side pull underclings, slap the sloper, and grab the jug.

routes.name: Reach
routes.description: Start with hands matched on a single digit edge and crank to a small edge above then top out.

routes.name: The Nose
routes.description: Climb the arete to a nervy topout.

routes.name: Dihedral Left
routes.description: Climb up a shallow dihedral finishing up and left.

routes.name: Dihedral Right
routes.description: Walk up a little shelf, use some pin scars to get up, and go up and right.

routes.name: Boulder 1 Traverse
routes.description: Traverse the whole boulder. It is much harder to go straight left from Three Pigs now and easier to go higher and use the slopers. Some go high around boot flake for a slightly easier version, while others go low there for the V4 version.

boulders.name: Slant Rock
boulders.description: This boulder is a few yards to the southeast of Boulder 1 and has a low angle west face that is often ascended with no hands.

routes.name: The Edge
routes.description: Climb the very easy west arete.

routes.name: Slant Rock Face Center
routes.description: Climb the center of the face using friction and small crimps.

routes.name: Slant Rock Face Left
routes.description: Climb the left side of the face.

routes.name: Slant Flake
routes.description: Sit start and climb the juggy rail up and left to the mantle topout.

boulders.name: Ampitheater
boulders.description: Above the south trail and Pile Ups is a low wall with an excellent traverse.

routes.name: Ampitheater Traverse
routes.description: Start on the right and make a delicate sequence across and down to better holds - easier pockets lead to the bulge, and a stiff little pull to a crack then easier ground to finish.

boulders.name: Pile Ups Boulder
boulders.description: The obvious short boulder next to the trail.

routes.name: Pile Ups Traverse
routes.description: Traverse the lip of the boulder left-to-right.

routes.name: Pile Driver
routes.description: Start at the flake-jug thingy, make a big move up to a sloping crimp and top out via a dyno for the lip or static moves out left.

routes.name: Pile Lieback
routes.description: Start matched on a good crimp, reach left for the lieback hold, pop for the sloping shelf and make a big move to top out at the apex of the boulder.

routes.name: Gomer Pile
routes.description: Ascend the face to the right of Pile Driver Lieback.

routes.name: Sledgehammer
routes.description: Start on decent edges and go up through sideulls.

routes.name: Pile Ups Mantle
routes.description: Mantle the lip on the right side of the boulder.

routes.name: White Angel Traverse (aka Low and Behold)
routes.description: Start hands matched on the left side of the boulder. Traverse right through the middle of the boulder on funky crimps and underclings.

boulders.name: Angel Wings Boulder
boulders.description: The boulder just behind the Pile Ups boulder.

routes.name: Scary Face
routes.description: Start to the left of Ghetto Bird and trend left on loose holds.

routes.name: Ghetto Bird
routes.description: Start on opposing sidepulls/flakes. Climb direct, up crimps and slopers to good holds at the apex of the boulder.

routes.name: Angel Wings
routes.description: Start on a decent left hand sidepull and a right hand crimp. treaverse right through a small edge to a good hold at the corner and do a big move for the top.

routes.name: Unknown
routes.description: Sit start at the corner of the boulder.

boulders.name: B1 Boulder
boulders.description: Numerous hard and overhanging classic problems on the west, south and east sides of this boulder.

routes.name: The Corner
routes.description: Starts out on the north side of the Northwest corner on the well chalked right facing sidepulls. Follow good holds up and slightly left.

routes.name: Hog Tied
routes.description: Easily up steep rock to a tricky and committing move to reach a hold which could be better, the crux is utilizing this to gain the top.

routes.name: Master of Reality
routes.description: Try and figure this one out without beta, you'll be glad you did - a wonderful unlikely sequence of almost zen-like moves leads to a small crimper (used be a nice jug) then smearing and stemming (crux) lead to the final slopers...

routes.name: Expansion Chamber
routes.description: Start left hand on a big sidepull and right on a shallow dish. Climb up to small crimps using desperate smears to a funky top out.

routes.name: The Ear
routes.description: Start with hands on edges at the bottom of a large hueco and go straight up through an undercling and small edges.

routes.name: ELP
routes.description: Jump off pads to two pockets. Campus to a flat sloping hold and rock over left to a crimp. Finish easier up crimps.

routes.name: Pink Floyd
routes.description: Jump start to an undercling with the left and the right on the Apesma sidepull. Crank to slopey sidepulls and a mantle top out.

routes.name: Apesma
routes.description: Start in a two finger pocket and fire to a crescent crimp. Move right to shallow sidepulls and top out. Direct (V8) and left (V5) variations have been done.

routes.name: The Crack
routes.description: Start with right hand undercling and left in sloping pocket. Figure out a way to gain the next pocket for the left and ake a big move out right to a jug. Finish with a commiting topout. Classic. Climbing the crack direct is V5.

routes.name: Flying Circus
routes.description: Start on the right side of the arête and stay on that side going straight up on big moves. The move of this route seems to be a big right hand deadpoint move to a lonely pocket on an otherwise smooth face.

routes.name: Two Scoops
routes.description: Starts on the arête using a side crimp. Go up and mainly left using big slopey holds and poor feet going through the two scoops and up to the top from there.

boulders.name: Turlock Boulder (aka Boulder 2)
boulders.description: The large obvious boulder right next to the trail.

routes.name: The Corner
routes.description: Start with the left hand on a rounded undercling and the right hand in a pocket. Climb uo the arete and mantel the lip to gain a crack.

routes.name: Silent Running
routes.description: Start at sidepill pockets, climb up through a seam to a crack.

routes.name: The Flake
routes.description: Climb up a right leaning flake to a rounded topout.

routes.name: Turlock Face
routes.description: Climb some thin crimpers to a great right hand crimper up high, highstep and hit the left sidepull (good) and you're at the top.

routes.name: The Bulge
routes.description: Start in the big pocket to the right under the bulge and go up and left doing a couple powerful moves mantling up to a deep little finger pocket on the face. Top out from here.

routes.name: Untold Story
routes.description: Climb pockets and a largish hole to finish on slopers near the top.

routes.name: Potholes (Left)
routes.description: Start at the left-most pothole lead and move right to a large cave-like pothole, pass this on the right to the finishing cave-like pothole, then left of this to the finishing jugs.

routes.name: Potholes (Center)
routes.description: Climb good incut holds to a large cave-like pothole, pass this on the right to the finishing cave-like pothole, then left of this to the finishing jugs.

routes.name: Potholes (Right)
routes.description: Traverse right out of the bottom cave and onto the right arete of the boulder, then up this a little then traverse left and jug up into the finishing cave, use good holds in the cave to reach the finishing jugs up and left.

routes.name: Ramada
routes.description: Start on a slopey dish and climb up edges and pockets to a huge jug finish.

routes.name: The Real Crystal Ball Mantle
routes.description: Start the same as Pliers, but move left through small crimps and mantle the crystal-ball like sloping shelf.

routes.name: Pliers
routes.description: Start with left hand on face high edh=ge and right on crimpy pocket. Climb up through good edges, then pinch the fin to gain the sloping angling rail with the left hand. Mantle the rounded ledge to top out.

routes.name: Slime
routes.description: Climb polished starting holds to gain a shallow pocket for the right hand. Lieback the fin with the left hand and press out the sloping mantle.

routes.name: Hoof and Mouth
routes.description: Climb or jump to large hueco, then move up and left to a jug at the lip.

routes.name: North Face
routes.description: Climb straight up the north face of the boulder.

routes.name: North Flake
routes.description: Start the sam as North Face but traverse right at the ledge and climb the flake to the top.

routes.name: Crowd Pleaser (aka Yabo Roof)
routes.description: Climb up the arching arete through flakes to a scary lip turn.

routes.name: Crystal Ball Mantle
routes.description: Jump to the 'crystal ball' jug and climb striaght up through the overhang.

boulders.name: Power Glide Boulder
boulders.description: This boulder lies just uphill from the trail.

routes.name: Power Glide (aka Snot Here)
routes.description: Start at the left edge of the boulder, traverse the slopey rail, reach up for the slot, use this to gain the crimp and make a big move for the jug.

routes.name: Standard Route
routes.description: Start with hands matched on a good hold in the horizontal crack and move up to small crimps then top out.

boulders.name: Split Rock
boulders.description: This easily identifiable boulder is just uphill from Power Glide and is split in two at an easy chimney.

routes.name: Dark Side of the Moon
routes.description: Start low and head up the left side then traverse over (crux) and finish up the right arete as with Vaino Problem.

routes.name: Vaino Problem
routes.description: Start with a right hand on the left arete and a poor left-hand sloper. Continue up the arete.

routes.name: Johnson Arete
routes.description: Climb the right arete

routes.name: Johnson Problem
routes.description: Start left hand on a large rounded side pull and right hand on a small right facing crimp. Climb up to a huge jug and over the bulge to the top.

routes.name: Split Decision
routes.description: Climb face moves to a lieback up the pin-scarred dihedral left of Johnson Problem. Usually top roped at 5.10b, but does get bouldered.

routes.name: Chimney
routes.description: Climb the obvious chimney that splits the boulder.

boulders.name: Spiral Boulder
boulders.description: The Huge boulder uphill from the trail slighly South of Split Rock.

routes.name: Borealis
routes.description: Start near the beginning of Spiral Traverse and climb the face above a sketchy landing.

routes.name: Spiral Traverse
routes.description: The classic traverse on the North side of the boulder goes left to right.

routes.name: Spiral Direct
routes.description: Start on small udges, use an undercling to gain a pocket, then the juggy hueco at the top.

routes.name: Unnamed
routes.description: Sit start with hands matched at a large jug/undercling. Move up and left to a diagonal rail, then up to and over the lip.

boulders.name: Couinard's Slab Boulder
boulders.description: A small boulder just uphill from the Spiral boulder with an obvious slab problem.

routes.name: Chouinard's Slab
routes.description: Climb the easy slab.

boulders.name: Slap Boulder
boulders.description: The obvious small chalked boulder just North of Spiral Traverse.

routes.name: Slap
routes.description: Climb the lowball face.

boulders.name: The Back Wall
boulders.description: This is the large / prominent wall around the corner (east) of Beethovens Wall. Many toprope problems ascend this wall and one boulder treavers of note.

routes.name: Potholes Traverse
routes.description: Traverse the wall between the cracks on crimps and gastons. Can be done in either direction.

boulders.name: Scrambled Eggs Boulder
boulders.description: This boulder lies just north of Beethoven's Wall.

routes.name: Scrambled Eggs
routes.description: Start on good two-hand ledge. Moves up left to a horizontal band of worsening holds to a very good bird hole. High step and finish up and left.

boulders.name: Unnamed Boulder
boulders.description: This boulder is directly north of Beethoven's Wall.

routes.name: Unnamed
routes.description: Climb the middle of the triangular shaped face

boulders.name: Pancake Boulder
boulders.description: This boulder lies north of Beethoven's Wall and forms the west side of a shady alcove.

routes.name: Pancake
routes.description: Sit start up to diagonal rail, then mantle.

boulders.name: Font Boulder
boulders.description: This boulder lies just north of the Pancake boulder and forms the west wall of a narrow corridor.

routes.name: Critter Crack
routes.description: Jam and lieback up to a two-finger pin scar and a worrying move (crux) to the rounded but good finishing holds.

routes.name: Mantlelobotomy
routes.description: Start with hands matched on a slopey undercling and climb up through small edges to the mantle.

routes.name: The Font
routes.description: Start on sidepulls in the pod and climb up through pockets to a heinous sloping mantle.

boulders.name: Blocky Boulder
boulders.description: A boulder north of Beethoven's wall that forms the east side of a shady alcove.

routes.name: Blocky
routes.description: Climb the blocky prow going up and right.

boulders.name: Fritz Boulder
boulders.description: A boulder north of Beethoven's wall that forms the east side of a shady alcove.

routes.name: Easy Face
routes.description: Climb the easy face in the corridor.

routes.name: Spooky (aka Hedgeclipper)
routes.description: A funky start leads to a shallow dish continuing up to a spooky topout.

routes.name: Fritz Face
routes.description: Start with an undercling ans climb small crimps to a sloping topout.

routes.name: Scorpion
routes.description: Start with a alow sidepull and climb small crimpt to a sting in the tail at the top.

boulders.name: Puggie Boulder
boulders.description: A small boulder about 20 yards west of the Font boulder.

routes.name: Puggie So What?
routes.description: A short climb up horizontal ledges.

boulders.name: Kodas Boulder
boulders.description: This boulder is downhill and west of the main Canyon cluster and can be located by the obvious chalked arete of Kodas Corner.

routes.name: Kodas Corner
routes.description: Us compression moves up the arete and the flake to the right, then commit to a big move for the lip and press out the cruz mantle. One of the best problems at Stoney Point and one of the best for the grade in So Cal.

boulders.name: Block Head Boulder
boulders.description: Boulder down the hill from the canyon area with an impressive arete.

routes.name: Largonaut
routes.description: Climb the northeast arete of the boulder starting off the boulder to the left. Starting from the gound is V8

routes.name: Router Bit
routes.description: Climb the center of the north face using manufactured pockets and edges.

routes.name: Yabo Arete
routes.description: Climb the striking northwest arete of the boulder

boulders.name: Carousel Rock
boulders.description: The huge boulder down in the flats under a large oak tree, almost to the train tracks.

routes.name: Carousel Traverse
routes.description: Traverse the entire boulder, starting basically anywhere, but typically starts at the left edge of the south face.

routes.name: Southwest Corner
routes.description: Climb edges and pockets to a mellow topout

boulders.name: Mozart's Wall
boulders.description: The popular north-facing toprope wall has a nice traverse along it's base.

routes.name: Mozart's Wall Traverse
routes.description: Traverse the entire base of the wall, typically from left to right

boulders.name: Quickstep Boulder
boulders.description: The boulder opposite Mozart'e wall in the corridor.

routes.name: Quckstep
routes.description: Start with compression and make a big move to a jus, top out straight up.

boulders.name: Mommy's Boys
boulders.description: Tall boulder with some nice easy topropes/highballs.

routes.name: Mommy's Boy Left
routes.description: Climb the left side of the face via a flake, move right and top out.

routes.name: Mommy's Boy Center
routes.description: Climb the center of the face on small edges.

routes.name: Mommy's Boy Right
routes.description: Climb the right side of the face via a tricky start and a crux mantle.

boulders.name: Boulder Opposite Mommy's Boys
boulders.description: The boulder on the other side of the corridor.

routes.name: Yabo Dyno
routes.description: Start low on decent edges and move right to a dyno from a sidepull and a small edge to a rounded hold. Located directly across from Mommy's Boys. Located on the opposite side of the boulder from Mommy's Boys.

routes.name: Pocket Traverse
routes.description: Traverse from left to right on bad feet to a cruxy sequence moving right then up to a ledgy rail. On the opposite side of the boulder form Mommy's Boys.

boulders.name: Ummagumma Boulder
boulders.description: A Large boulder that appears when the trail begins to flatten out.

routes.name: Ummagumma
routes.description: Start form the large hueco, fire to another, distant, hueco, then top out somehow.

boulders.name: Boulder Behind Ummagumma
boulders.description: This is the boulder directly behind the Ummagumma boulder.

routes.name: Fighting with Alligators
routes.description: Sit start and climb up and right through the prow and then along the lip of the boulder. Pull over the jug midway in the face.

routes.name: Rodeo Style
routes.description: A direct start below the finishing jug of Fighting with Alligators.

boulders.name: Boulder
boulders.description: To the right (North) of the trail just downhill from Ummagumma.

routes.name: Face Problem
routes.description: Start on edges and climb through the hueco. A harder sit start is possible
